plan: For the next rounds, I'll implement a mixed bidding strategy. Initially, I'll bid slightly below my value to gather data on Betty's and Charles's bidding tendencies. In subsequent rounds, I'll adjust my bid closer to my value if I notice they bid aggressively. Occasionally, I'll bid slightly above my value to test their maximum willingness to pay, accepting minor losses for strategic insights. I'll also vary my bids unpredictably to avoid patterns, ensuring they can't easily counter-strategize. This approach balances short-term losses with long-term profit maximization by understanding and adapting to opponents' strategies.

In the early rounds, I'll test a range of bidding strategies to gather data on opponent behaviors. I'll start with conservative bids slightly below my value to minimize losses while observing trends. As rounds progress, I'll increase aggression by bidding closer to my value, especially if opponents show consistent patterns. Occasionally, I'll bid above my value to test their limits and gather insights. I'll adapt strategies based on observed patterns, aiming to maximize profit by balancing risk and reward. By round 10, I'll refine my approach, focusing on maximizing expected value based on accumulated data.

To maximize long-term profit, I'll explore diverse bidding strategies. Initially, I'll bid slightly below my value to gauge competitors' behaviors. In early rounds, I'll test aggressive bids near my value to win more often and gather data on their tendencies. As patterns emerge, I'll adjust my bids to undercut opponents while ensuring positive profit margins. I'll also experiment with riskier bids when my value is low to understand their limits. By analyzing outcomes and refining strategies, I aim to balance risk and reward, optimizing profit across the 15 rounds.
